channel.title: Need fast help!
channel.description:
Hello i need some quick help its 1am right now got to work in the morning so i want it fixed now.
So i got this client with its run.bat which works fine with me
So this is the orginal one
@echo off title MediaScape Client "%programfiles%\java\jdk1.7.0_04\bin\java.exe" -Xmx500m client exit
But it didn't work on others pc but they still got java so i guessed its because they haved the newest java and/or they have (x86)
So i want it to be working on every pc with java on it i tried this one too.. @echo off title Client cd java -Xmx500m client pause
that worked fine too.
Anyone that can help me please

item.title: Need fast help!

@ouassim wrote:

Can somebody please help me on teamviewer

Read full topic

item.title: Need fast help!

item.description:
@n10si_t wrote:

ouassim:

They dont have too look at the big servers they dont let people change there shit there has to be another way

big servers use webclients or their run.bat finds where java is installed on the computer

Read full topic

item.title: Need fast help!
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

If people just set their environment variables, none of this would be a problem.

Read full topic

item.title: Need fast help!
item.dc:creator: @JavaTC JavaTC
item.description:
@JavaTC wrote:

Here’s the play.bat from Mythscape, you’ll have to edit it just a bit though

[code]@echo off
color 0c
cd locandclass

:Start
echo IGNORE ALL ‘CANNOT FUND PATH SPECIFIED’ ERRORS.
echo Auto Detection has found a compatable system.
echo Initiating Client. Please Standby.
if exist “%HOMEDRIVE%\Program Files (x86)” goto x64
goto x86

:x64
echo Auto Detection has retrieved a 64 bit system.
echo Initiating Client (x64). Please Standby.
echo.
“%HOMEDRIVE%/Program Files (x86)/Java/jre7/bin/java.exe” -Xmx300m client
“%HOMEDRIVE%/Program Files (x86)/Java/jre6/bin/java.exe” -Xmx300m client
“%HOMEDRIVE%/Program Files (x86)/Java/jre1.6.0/bin/java.exe” -Xmx300m client

:x86
echo Auto Detection completed. 32 Bit system retrieved.
echo Initiating Client (x86). Please Standby.
echo.
“%HOMEDRIVE%/Program Files/Java/jre1.6.0/bin/java.exe” -Xmx300m client
“%HOMEDRIVE%/Program Files/Java/jre6/bin/java.exe” -Xmx300m client
“%HOMEDRIVE%/Program Files/Java/jre7/bin/java.exe” -Xmx300m client
exit[/code]

Read full topic

item.title: Need fast help!
item.dc:creator: @The_Web_Guy The Web Guy
item.description:
@The_Web_Guy wrote:

Best way is to use the jarred client file that you’d use for the webclient, it’s easily universal for any Java version on any Computer Operating System. However, if you don’t want to do that or you currently don’t have that set up yet, here are a few files that will work for x86 (64-bit) computers and standard (32-bit) computers. (batch files ; for running)

32-bit (Recommended save as ‘Run.bat’)

@echo off title YOURCLIENT "C:\Program Files\Java\jre6\bin\java.exe" -Xmx500m Gui 10 0 highmem members 32 pause

if that one doesn’t work, try this.

@echo on "C:\Program Files\Java\jre6\bin\java.exe" -Xmx500m -cp .;Theme.jar Gui pause

You’ll have to look at your already existing code to see what it’s like and find out which one is best with you, i’m sure you’ll be able to compare some of the patterns and find out which one is best, you may have to change or alter the code a bit.

64-bit / x86 (Recommended save as "Run (x86).bat’)

@Echo off ECHO You may now close this window Cd bin "C:\Program Files (x86)\Java\jre6\bin\Javaw.exe" -Xmx254m -classpath .;Theme.jar Gui 0 0 lowmem members 32 exit

The above ‘Run (x86).bat’ is for clients that have a /bin folder in them.

By looking at your already existing run.bat files, and the three that I have provided you, you should be able to get a universal one working fairly soon. If you can’t after a few minutes, i’ll check back and post the code for your existing run.bat and i’ll create some run.bat files for you.

Read full topic

item.title: Need fast help!
item.dc:creator: @ouassim ouassim
item.description:
@ouassim wrote:

Hello i need some quick help its 1am right now got to work in the morning so i want it fixed now.

So i got this client with its run.bat which works fine with me

So this is the orginal one

@echo off
title MediaScape Client
“%programfiles%\java\jdk1.7.0_04\bin\java.exe” -Xmx500m client
exit

But it didn’t work on others pc but they still got java so i guessed its because they haved the newest java and/or they have (x86)

So i want it to be working on every pc with java on it i tried this one too…
@echo off
title Client
cd
java -Xmx500m client
pause

that worked fine too.

Anyone that can help me please

Read full topic
